intro: Polygala praticola, commonly known as the narrow-leaf milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygalaceae family, which includes around 2,000 species of flowering plants. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom in late spring to early summer. Polygala praticola is often found in sagebrush steppe and desert grassland ecosystems.
